summary: Defines core base classes for Git objects and index entries, offering common functionality such as identity management, path handling, hashing, equality, lazy loading, caching, and data streaming to support consistent manipulation of blobs, trees, commits, tags, and submodule references within a repository.
business_intent: Provide a reusable foundation that abstracts Git data structures, enabling higherâ€‘level components to interact with repository objects reliably and efficiently, while handling serialization, caching, and lazy access transparently.
